meanings.definition: A person who informs on someone else.
meanings.sent1: The snitches told the teacher about the missing pencil.
meanings.sent2: The snitches in the neighborhood always report any suspicious activity.
meanings.sent3: The snitches at the party made sure everyone followed the rules.
meanings.sent4: The snitches in the office are like human security cameras.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the snitches, they see everything and tell on you.

meanings.sent1: He snitches to the principal whenever someone breaks the rules.
meanings.sent2: She snitches on her friends when they do something wrong.
meanings.sent3: The cat snitches on the dog for stealing treats from the pantry.
meanings.sent4: The spy snitches on the enemy's plans to his own team.
meanings.sent5: The little bird snitches to the farmer about the fox lurking nearby.

meanings.sent1: The snitches in the jar were all different colors.
meanings.sent2: She collected snitches from different countries as souvenirs.
meanings.sent3: The snitches on the table looked like tiny candies.
meanings.sent4: The snitches on the shelf sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The snitches in the box were carefully arranged by size.
